body_html:
I also came across this problem, when I tried to swap the values of two Variables. It seems that only +0 trick works, instead of read_value().

This works:

a = tf.Variable(1.)
b = tf.Variable(0.)
a_old = a + 0
b_old = b + 0
with tf.control_dependencies([a_old]):
    assign_a = a.assign(b_old)
with tf.control_dependencies([b_old]):
    assign_b = b.assign(a_old)
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
sess.run([a_old, b_old, assign_a, assign_b])
# => [1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0]

This doesn't work:

a = tf.Variable(1.)
b = tf.Variable(0.)
a_old = a.read_value()
b_old = b.read_value()
with tf.control_dependencies([a_old]):
    assign_a = a.assign(b_old)
with tf.control_dependencies([b_old]):
    assign_b = b.assign(a_old)
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
sess.run([a_old, b_old, assign_a, assign_b])
# => [0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0]

Why? I'm really confused.

I also came across this problem, when I tried to swap the values of two Variables. It seems that only +0 trick works, instead of read_value().
This works:
a = tf.Variable(1.)
b = tf.Variable(0.)
a_old = a + 0
b_old = b + 0
with tf.control_dependencies([a_old]):
    assign_a = a.assign(b_old)
with tf.control_dependencies([b_old]):
    assign_b = b.assign(a_old)
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
sess.run([a_old, b_old, assign_a, assign_b])
# => [1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0]
This doesn't work:
a = tf.Variable(1.)
b = tf.Variable(0.)
a_old = a.read_value()
b_old = b.read_value()
with tf.control_dependencies([a_old]):
    assign_a = a.assign(b_old)
with tf.control_dependencies([b_old]):
    assign_b = b.assign(a_old)
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
sess.run([a_old, b_old, assign_a, assign_b])
# => [0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0]
Why? I'm really confused.
body:
I also came across this problem, when I tried to swap the values of two Variables. It seems that only `+0` trick works, instead of `read_value()`.

This works:
```python
a = tf.Variable(1.)
b = tf.Variable(0.)
a_old = a + 0
b_old = b + 0
with tf.control_dependencies([a_old]):
    assign_a = a.assign(b_old)
with tf.control_dependencies([b_old]):
    assign_b = b.assign(a_old)
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
sess.run([a_old, b_old, assign_a, assign_b])
# => [1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0]
```

This doesn't work:
```python
a = tf.Variable(1.)
b = tf.Variable(0.)
a_old = a.read_value()
b_old = b.read_value()
with tf.control_dependencies([a_old]):
    assign_a = a.assign(b_old)
with tf.control_dependencies([b_old]):
    assign_b = b.assign(a_old)
sess = tf.Session()
sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
sess.run([a_old, b_old, assign_a, assign_b])
# => [0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0]
```

Why? I'm really confused.
